intro: Poecilochroma boissieri, commonly known as the Boissier's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cup-shaped structures. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
